intro: Pteryxia calcarea, commonly known as the limestone pterygia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy, succulent leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found on rocky or limestone soils. Pteryxia calcarea is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent structure.
